Authors: M. Zhang, C. Q. Wang, T. H. Li, B. Song
Title:
A new species of Chalciporus (Boletaceae, Boletales) with
strongly radially arranged pores
Abstract:
Chalciporus radiatus sp. nov., discovered in southern
China, is described and illustrated as a new species based on both
morphological and molecular data. Morphologically, its brown to reddish
brown hymenophore is very distinctive, which is strongly radially porous
even lamellate with lower intervenose to anastomosing veins. The
arrestive hymenophore, combined with the yellowish white flesh
